original: Exhibit 10.11 Execution Copy STRATEGIC ALLIANCE AGREEMENT This STRATEGIC ALLIANCE AGREEMENT  (this “Agreement ”) is made as of December 21, 2006 by and among  OXBOW CARBON & MINERALS LLC , a Delaware limited liability company having a principal office address at 1601 Forum Place, Suite 1400, West Palm Beach, Florida 33401 (“Oxbow”) and GLOBAL ENERGY, INC. , an Ohio corporation having a principal office address at 312 Walnut Street, Suite 2650, Cincinnati, Ohio 45202 (“ Global Energy ”). Oxbow and Global each may be referred to from time to time herein as a “ Party” and collectively as the “ Parties”.
ollama_generated:
Exhibit 10.11 Execution Copy STRATEGIC ALLIANCE AGREEMENT

This STRATEGIC ALLIANCE AGREEMENT (hereinafter referred to as "Agreement") is entered into on December 21, 2006 by and between OXBOW CARBON & MINERALS LLC, a Delaware limited liability company with a principal office at 1601 Forum Place, Suite 1400, West Palm Beach, Florida 33401 ("Oxbow"), and GLOBAL ENERGY, INC., an Ohio corporation with a principal office at 312 Walnut Street, Suite 2650, Cincinnati, Ohio 45202 ("Global Energy"). Each of Oxbow and Global Energy shall individually be referred to as a "Party" and collectively as the "Parties".

In this revised clause, the condition has been inverted. Instead of stating that the Agreement is made by and among the Parties, it now states that the Agreement is entered into by Oxbow and Global Energy. This subtle change indicates a slightly different perspective on the formation of the agreement, emphasizing the independent actions taken by both parties to establish it.

Payment Responsibilities: The party designated as (Maker) shall be primarily responsible for initiating all electronic funds transfers necessary to settle any and all payments under this agreement; however, Global Energy, Inc., at its discretion, may choose to cover any initial expenses or costs as a courtesy, with the expectation that subsequent payments will be made by (Maker).

original: 2. Strategic Alliance . The Parties hereby form a strategic alliance having the following key elements:
ollama_generated:
2. Collaborative Agreement . The Parties herein voluntarily establish a collaborative agreement, with the following essential components:

This revised clause suggests a more cooperative and less binding nature of the partnership compared to the original "strategic alliance." The term "collaborative agreement" implies a mutual understanding and commitment, but with a slightly softer connotation than "alliance," which often implies a stronger, more formal bond.

original: (ii) Oxbow shall be a preferred supplier of coal, coal fines, gob or waste coal products (collectively, “ Coal”) to gasification projects owned or controlled by Global Energy.
ollama_generated: (ii) It is understood that Global Energy may preferentially consider Oxbow as a potential supplier for coal, coal fines, gob or waste coal products (collectively, "Coal"), when procuring such materials for its gasification projects; however, Global Energy reserves the right to source Coal from alternative suppliers at its sole discretion.

original: (i) Oxbow will identify Oxbow petroleum coke related sites for collaboration with Global Energy.
modified: (ii) Global Energy shall propose to Oxbow potential sites for collaboration, concerning Global Energy's understanding of petroleum coke related locations, which Oxbow may choose to engage in further discussions and collaboration at its discretion.

original: (ii) Global Energy will identify Global Energy petroleum coke related sites for collaboration with Oxbow.
ollama_generated: (ii') Upon mutual agreement, Oxbow may propose potential collaboration sites involving petroleum coke originating from Global Energy's operations, which Global Energy shall consider in good faith and respond promptly.

original: (b) Revenues and Benefits to Oxbow . If Oxbow makes the Lima Investment:

This revised clause emphasizes that the right to potential revenue is contingent upon Oxbow's decision to make the investment, implying a slightly more voluntary and less obligatory nature of the action.

original: (c) The Shares .
ollama_generated:
(c) The Holder shall have the right to transfer the Shares, provided that such transfer shall be subject to the prior written consent of the Company, which may withhold its consent in its sole discretion.

Rewritten clause for a weaker obligation:

(c) The Company shall have the option, but not the obligation, to approve any transfer of Shares by the Holder. Such approval shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed. If the Company fails to respond within a reasonable timeframe, such non-response shall be deemed to constitute its consent.

original: (g) Qualification; Organization . (g) Qualification; Organization:
Oxbow acknowledges that Global Energy, while not necessarily holding certifications or licenses in all jurisdictions listed on Schedule 4(g), maintains the necessary registrations or permits wherever such requirements are legally applicable and advisable given the nature of its business. original: (h) Bankruptcy . Neither Global Energy nor GEC has filed any voluntary petition in bankruptcy or been adjudicated bankrupt or insolvent, or filed any petition or answer seeking any reorganization, liquidation, dissolution or similar relief under any federal or state bankruptcy, insolvency or other debtor relief or similar law, or sought or consented to or acquiesced in the appointment of any trustee, receiver, conservator or liquidator of all or any substantial part of its properties. No court of competent jurisdiction has entered an order, judgment or decree approving a petition filed against Global Energy or GEC seeking any reorganization, arrangement, composition, readjustment, liquidation, dissolution or similar relief under any federal or state bankruptcy act, or other debtor relief or similar law, and no other liquidator has been appointed for any of them, or of all or any substantial part of any of their properties. No proceeding has been commenced or, to Global Energy’s knowledge, has been threatened, seeking to adjudicate Global Energy or GEC as bankrupt or seeking any reorganization, arrangement, composition, readjustment, liquidation, dissolution or other similar relief.
ollama_generated: (h) Bankruptcy Proceedings and Insolvency Events. Neither Global Energy nor GEC has initiated a voluntary filing for bankruptcy, been declared bankrupt, insolvent, or involved in any proceedings under federal or state laws concerning bankruptcy, insolvency, or debt relief. No court of competent jurisdiction has authorized the appointment of a trustee, receiver, conservator, or liquidator for all or a significant portion of Global Energy's or GEC's assets, nor has any such individual been appointed. No petition seeking bankruptcy, reorganization, arrangement, composition, readjustment, liquidation, dissolution, or similar relief under federal or state bankruptcy acts, debtor relief laws, or other similar legislation has been approved by a court of competent jurisdiction against Global Energy or GEC, and no such proceedings have been commenced or, to our knowledge, threatened.

original: (b) Authority; Enforceability . Oxbow has full power and authority to execute, deliver and perform this Agreement, and the other agreements and instruments to be executed and delivered by it pursuant hereto, and to consummate the transactions contemplated hereby and thereby. This Agreement has been duly and validly authorized, executed and delivered by Oxbow and, assuming due authorization, execution and delivery hereof by Global Energy, is a legal, valid and binding obligation of Oxbow, enforceable against Oxbow in accordance with its terms, except as enforcement thereof may be limited by applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, moratorium or other similar laws affecting the rights of creditors generally or by general principles of equity (regardless of whether such enforceability is considered in a proceeding at law or equity). No other or further authorization is required for Oxbow’s performance hereunder other than those authorizations to be obtained by Oxbow on or prior to the consummation of the transactions contemplated by this Agreement.
modified: (b) Authority and Enforceability: Global Energy possesses the full right and capacity to execute, deliver, and perform this Agreement, as well as any other agreements or instruments required by it under the terms herein. This Agreement has been duly and validly authorized, executed, and delivered by Global Energy. Upon Oxbow's due authorization, execution, and delivery of this Agreement, it constitutes a legal, valid, and binding obligation for Global Energy, enforceable against Global Energy in accordance with its terms, except for any limitations to enforcement that may arise from applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, moratorium, or similar laws affecting the rights of debtors, or general principles of equity (regardless of whether such enforceability is considered in a proceeding at law or equity). No additional authorizations are required for Global Energy's performance under this Agreement beyond those to be obtained by it prior to the completion of transactions contemplated by this Agreement. Any obligations imposed on Oxbow under this Agreement may be subject to limitations based on applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, moratorium, or similar laws affecting the rights of creditors.

original: (c) No Violation: Consents . The execution and delivery of, and performance under, this Agreement by Oxbow and the consummation by Oxbow of the transactions contemplated hereby and thereby, will not: (a) violate any provision of Applicable Law; (b) violate the provisions of any Governmental Approval, or the organizational or governing documents of Oxbow, or any agreement or other restriction to which any Oxbow is a party or by or pursuant to which Oxbow or the property of Oxbow is bound or subject; or (c) result in a breach of or constitute (with due notice or lapse of time or both) a default under (or give rise to any right of termination, consent, cancellation, or acceleration under) any material contract or agreement to which Oxbow is a party or by or pursuant to which Oxbow’s property is subject or bound. The execution and delivery of, and performance under, this Agreement by Oxbow will not require any Consent, other than (i) such Consents which, if not obtained or made, will not prevent Oxbow from performing its obligations hereunder, (ii) such Consents which become applicable to Oxbow solely as a result of the specific regulatory status of Global Energy or GEC, and (iii) the Consents set forth on  Schedule 5(c) .
ollama_generated: (c) Non-infringement Obligation: Grants Immunity. The execution, delivery, and compliance by Oxbow with this Agreement and the transactions detailed herein will not trigger: (a) a contravention of any applicable law, (b) a breach or violation of any government approval, organizational documents, internal policies, or contracts that bind or govern Oxbow, or (c) an event of default, termination right, cancellation option, or acceleration event under any material agreement to which Oxbow is a party, except for the events specified in (i) Schedule 5(c), (ii) circumstances where such breaches or violations are immaterial and do not impair Oxbow's ability to fulfill its obligations under this Agreement, or (iii) instances where the regulatory status of Global Energy or GEC necessitates specific consents. The execution, delivery, and compliance by Oxbow with this Agreement will only require consent in exceptional circumstances, as outlined in subclauses (i), (ii), and (iii).

original: (a) Oxbow Conditions . The obligation of Oxbow to proceed with the Closing of the Share purchase contemplated under Section 1 is subject to the satisfaction of all of the conditions set forth in this Section 6(a):

(iv) No Injunction . No preliminary or permanent injunction or other order or Decree by any Governmental Authority which, prevents the consummation of the purchase of the Shares shall have been issued and remain in effect (and Global Energy and Oxbow agree to use commercially reasonable efforts to have any such injunction, order, or Decree lifted).
ollama_generated: (iv) Right to Pursue Legal Remedies . The parties acknowledge that they may seek preliminary or permanent injunctions or other legal remedies by a Governmental Authority if needed, but any such action shall not be used to unduly delay the transaction. However, the parties will make reasonable efforts to expedite the resolution of any such proceedings and lift any injunction, order, or Decree that may arise.

original: (iii) If a Party is requested or required by legal or regulatory authority to disclose any Confidential Information, such disclosing Party shall promptly notify the other Party of such request or requirement prior to disclosure so that the other Party may seek an appropriate protective order and/or waive compliance with the terms of this Agreement. If a protective order or other remedy is not obtained, or the other Party waives compliance with the provisions hereof, the disclosing Party agrees to furnish only that portion of the Confidential Information that it reasonably determines, in consultation with its counsel, is consistent with the scope of the subpoena or demand, and to exercise reasonable efforts to obtain assurance that confidential treatment will be accorded such Confidential Information.
ollama_generated: (iii) In the event a Party is compelled by a legal or regulatory authority to disclose any Confidential Information, they shall provide immediate notice to the other Party about such compulsion, allowing sufficient time for the recipient Party to contest the disclosure and seek protective measures. If, despite these efforts, the requested disclosure cannot be prevented, the disclosing Party will endeavor to limit the scope of the disclosure to the minimum necessary, in consultation with legal counsel, and shall take all reasonable steps to ensure that the Confidential Information is treated confidentially and afforded appropriate protection upon disclosure. However, the burden of proof for justifying any failure to maintain confidentiality shall not be on the Party making the disclosure.

original: 8. Term; Termination and Remedies .
ollama_generated:
8. Duration; Cessation and Recourses.

In the event that either Party elects to terminate this Agreement, they shall provide written notice thirty (30) days prior to such termination, with the exception that in cases of material breach or non-compliance, immediate termination may be enacted. The non-breaching Party shall retain the right to seek appropriate legal remedies in the event of unlawful actions or failure to fulfill obligations by the other Party. However, any payments made prior to the effective date of termination shall not be refundable.

original: (a) Term. This Agreement shall be for an initial term of five (5) years, and unless earlier terminated in accordance with this Agreement, shall automatically renew for an additional term of five (5) years thereafter.
modified: (b) Duration. Commencing from the effective date of this Agreement, it will continue indefinitely, unless either party gives written notice of termination, at least one hundred and eighty (180) days prior to the intended termination date. However, there shall be an initial fixed period of five (5) years during which neither party may initiate termination without cause. After this initial term, should neither party elect to terminate the Agreement, it will automatically extend for another five (5) year period.

original: (c) Remedies. In the event of termination of this Agreement, the Party not in default shall be entitled to obtain all appropriate relief available to it under this Agreement and at law or equity.
modified: (c) Remedies upon Termination. Upon termination of this Agreement by either party for any reason, the defaulting Party shall have no right to seek or obtain any remedy or relief under this Agreement or at law or equity, and instead shall be solely liable for any damages, losses, or expenses incurred by the non-defaulting Party as a result.

original: “Act” means the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, and the rules and regulations thereunder.
ollama_generated: "Under this agreement, 'Act' encompasses the Securities Act of 1933, as it currently stands and any amendments or subsequent changes thereto, along with their accompanying rules and regulations."

original: “Decree” means any claim, consent decree, conciliation agreement, settlement agreement, outstanding judgment, rule, order, writ, injunction or other decree of a Governmental Authority.
ollama_generated: "Decree" encompasses any government-issued decision, including but not limited to claims, consent decrees, conciliation agreements, settlement agreements, final judgments, rules, orders, writs, injunctions, or other binding directives by a Governmental Authority. Notably, this definition includes any future modifications or amendments to such decrees that may be issued during the term of this agreement.

original: “Environmental Claim ” means any and all administrative or judicial actions, suits, orders, claims, liens, notices, notices of violations, investigations, complaints, proceedings, or other written communication, whether criminal or civil, pursuant to or relating to any applicable Environmental Law by any Person, including any Governmental Authority, based upon, alleging, asserting, or claiming any actual or potential (i) violation of, or liability under any Environmental Law, (ii) violation of any Environmental Permit, or (iii) liability for investigatory costs, cleanup costs, removal costs, remedial costs, response costs, natural resource damages, property damage, personal injury, fines, or penalties arising out of, based on, resulting from, or related to the presence, Release, or threatened Release into the environment of any Hazardous Materials at, from, or related to any Real Property or any other property owned, leased, licensed, or operated by any of the Companies, including any off-site location to which Hazardous Materials, or materials containing Hazardous Materials, were sent for handling, storage, treatment or disposal.
ollama_generated: "Environmental Matter" refers to any administrative or judicial actions, suits, orders, claims, liens, notices, notices of violations, investigations, complaints, proceedings, or other written communication, whether criminal or civil, instigated by or against any Party, including Governmental Authorities, predicated on, accusing, asserting, or implying any actual or potential (i) infraction of, or responsibility under any Environmental Regulation, (ii) infraction of any Environmental Permit, or (iii) liability for investigatory costs, cleanup costs, removal costs, remedial costs, response costs, natural resource damages, property damage, personal injury, fines, or penalties stemming from, derived from, arising at, emanating from, or associated with the existence, discharge, or imminent discharge of any Hazardous Substances at, from, or in relation to any Real Property or any other property that any of the Companies possess, rent, license, or manage, including any off-site locations to which Hazardous Substances, or materials containing Hazardous Substances, were sent for handling, storage, treatment, or disposal. In this context, "Party" includes any third party with a claim against any of the Companies.

original: “Governmental Approval ” means any authorization, approval, consent, waiver, license, filing, registration, ruling, permit or certification by or with any Governmental Authority, including all environmental permits.
modified: "Governmental Approvals" encompass any necessary authorizations, consents, waivers, licenses, filings, registrations, rulings, permits, or certifications issued by or on behalf of a Governmental Authority, excluding any self-regulatory approvals, consents, or permissions not directly involving a government entity. This specifically includes all environmental permits.

original: “Governmental Authority ” means any applicable federal, state, county, municipal or local governmental, judicial or regulatory authority, agency, arbitration board, body, commission, instrumentality or court.
ollama_generated:
"Referenced Entity" denotes any relevant federal, state, county, municipal, or local governmental, judicial, or administrative entities, boards, agencies, arbitral panels, bodies, commissions, instrumentalities, or tribunals that may exercise authority over this agreement.

By making the term more passive and less definitive, the new clause subtly shifts some responsibility to the parties involved instead of explicitly stating that they must comply with all relevant authorities as in the original clause.

original: “Hazardous Material ” means (i) any substance or material regulated under applicable Environmental Laws or any other product, substance, pollutant, chemical, material or waste whose presence, nature, quantity and/or intensity of existence, use, manufacture, disposal, transportation, spill, Release or effect, either by itself or in combination with other materials used by the Business, is either potentially injurious to the public health, safety or welfare, or the environment, or (ii) could reasonably be expected to provide a basis for liability of any of the Companies or to any Governmental Authority or other Person under any Applicable Environmental Law. Hazardous Material shall include, without limitation, infectious or toxic substances, pollutants, radioactive materials, toxic hydrocarbons, petroleum or petro chemical products, gasoline, oil, diesel fuel or polychlorinated biphenyls or any products, by-products or fractions thereof, and asbestos.
ollama_generated: "Hazardous Material" refers to (i) any substance or material subject to regulation under relevant Environmental Laws, or any other product, substance, pollutant, chemical, material, or waste whose presence, characteristics, quantity, or intensity of existence, use, production, disposal, transportation, leakage, discharge, or impact, individually or in combination with others used by the Business, poses a potential risk to public safety, health, or well-being, or the environment. Additionally, it encompasses (ii) any substance, pollutant, chemical, material, or waste whose presence may reasonably serve as a basis for legal action against any of the Companies, a Governmental Authority, or any Person under any Applicable Environmental Law. "Hazardous Material" extends to, but is not limited to, infectious or toxic substances, pollutants, radioactive materials, toxic hydrocarbons, petroleum or petrochemical products, gasoline, oil, diesel fuel, polychlorinated biphenyls, or any related products, by-products, or fractions. The term does not imply that the presence of such materials automatically constitutes liability but rather establishes a potential basis for such liability.

original: “Lima Project ” has the meaning specified in Section 3.
ollama_generated:
"The term 'Lima Project,' as used herein, is defined in accordance with the interpretations provided in Section 3."

This rewording maintains the original meaning but places a slight emphasis on the idea that the interpretation of the term comes from Section 3, potentially implying that other sources could also be valid for understanding its meaning.

original: “Proceedings ” means judicial or administrative actions, labor disputes, suits, proceedings, arbitrations, citations, complaints, or investigations.
ollama_generated: "Dispute Resolution Procedures" encompass any judicial, administrative, or internal proceedings, labor disagreements, claims, hearings, arbitration sessions, notices, grievances, or inquiries that may arise concerning the terms of this agreement.

original: If to Global:
ollama_generated: Should circumstances necessitate a breach of this Agreement by Local Party, Global shall have the discretionary right, but not the obligation, to terminate this Agreement upon providing written notice to Local Party. In such an event, Local Party shall be liable for any damages arising from said breach, subject to the limits specified in this Agreement. However, if Global elects to continue with this Agreement post-breach, it will not have grounds for future claims regarding the initial breach.

original: (e) Successor and Assigns: No Partnership . This Agreement shall be binding upon and shall inure to the benefit of the Parties and their respective Affiliates, and to their respective successors and permitted assigns. modified: (e) Non-Successors and Non-Assigns: The Parties acknowledge that this Agreement is not binding upon them or their respective Affiliates, nor will it inure to their benefit, with regard to any successors or assigns they may have at a later date. This Agreement shall only apply to the specific parties named herein and shall not create a partnership among them.

original: (g) Attorneys’ Fees . In the event either Party files an action to enforce or otherwise arising out of this Agreement, the prevailing Party in such action shall be entitled to reasonable attorneys’ fees and court costs in addition to such other relief to which it may be entitled.
modified:
(g) Attorneys' Expenditures . Should any dispute arise between the Parties concerning this Agreement or the need for either Party to initiate legal proceedings, the non-prevailing Party shall assume the responsibility of reimbursing the prevailing Party for all reasonable legal fees and court expenses, in addition to any other remedies that may be granted.

This clause shifts the responsibility of paying attorneys' fees from the prevailing party to the non-prevailing party in case of a dispute or legal action arising out of this Agreement.
